def_en: Best is the superlative of good .
Best is the superlative of well .

def_cn: 最好的；绝佳的
def_en: The best is used to refer to things of the highest quality or standard.

def_cn: 最大努力；最高成就；最好水平
def_en: Someone's best is the greatest effort or highest achievement or standard that they are capable of.

def_cn: 最好的结果；顶多
def_en: If you say that something is the best that can be done or hoped for, you think it is the most pleasant, successful, or useful thing that can be done or hoped for.

def_cn: 最；极
def_en: If you like something best or like it the best, you prefer it.

def_cn: （用于构成以good和well开头的复合形容词的最高级，如well-known的最高级为best-known）
def_en: Best is used to form the superlative of compound adjectives beginning with 'good' and 'well'. For example, the superlative of 'well-known' is 'best-known'.
second best; Sunday best;

def_cn: （用于道别或信件末尾）万事如意，一切顺利
def_en: You can say 'All the best' when you are saying goodbye to someone, or at the end of a letter.

def_cn: 最好的是
def_en: You use best of all to indicate that what you are about to mention is the thing that you prefer or that has most advantages out of all the things you have mentioned.

def_cn: 尽全力；竭尽所能；尽最大努力
def_en: If someone does something as best they can, they do it as well as they can, although it is very difficult.

def_cn: 充其量；顶多；至多
def_en: You use at best to indicate that even if you describe something as favourably as possible or if it performs as well as it possibly can, it is still not very good.

def_cn: 尽力；竭尽所能
def_en: If you do your best or try your best to do something, you try as hard as you can to do it, or do it as well as you can.

def_cn: （综合考虑起来）是最好的
def_en: If you say that something is for the best, you mean it is the most desirable or helpful thing that could have happened or could be done, considering all the circumstances.

def_cn: （尤指冰释前嫌后）最好的朋友；知己
def_en: If two people are the best of friends, they are close friends, especially when they have had a disagreement or fight in the past.

def_cn: 最好（有些人认为此用法不规范）
def_en: If you say that someone had best do something or that they'd best do it, you mean they ought to do it. Some people consider this to be non-standard.

def_cn: （因经验丰富）最清楚，最明白
def_en: If you say that a particular person knows best, you mean that they have a lot of experience and should therefore be trusted to make decisions for other people.

def_cn: 看起来处于自己最迷人的状态
def_en: If you look your best, you are looking as smart and attractive as you can.

def_cn: 乐观地尽可能利用（逆境）
def_en: If you make the best of something, you accept an unsatisfactory situation cheerfully and try to manage as well as you can. In British English, you can also say that you make the best of a bad job .

to the best of your ability→see: ability;  the best of the bunch→see: bunch;  to hope for the best→see: hope;  to the best of your knowledge→see: knowledge;  best of luck→see: luck;  the best part→see: part;  at the best of times→see: time;  the best of both worlds→see: world;
